entries.title: The Papers: 'Pay up, PM' and 'Navy probes sex pest scandal'
entries.description: The papers report a visit by Rishi Sunak to a Croydon hospital and claims about misconduct in the Navy.

entries.title: Paul Pelosi attack: Violent extremism warning ahead of US election
entries.description: Hours after Nancy Pelosi's husband is attacked, US intelligence warns candidates face a "heightened risk".

entries.title: Trapped in Saudi Arabia: A mother's fight to free her daughter
entries.description: Carly took her daughter to Saudi Arabia to visit her father. Three years later, she's still there.

entries.title: Putin pins Ukraine hopes on winter and divisive US politics
entries.description: As fears grow of Russian nuclear escalation over Ukraine, Steve Rosenberg explains why he considers such a drastic step unlikely.

entries.title: Nancy Pelosi's husband Paul recovering after hammer attack surgery
entries.description: The intruder allegedly demanded to see top US Democrat Nancy Pelosi, and left her husband with a fractured skull.

entries.title: UK foreign aid being spent in Britain passes £4bn mark, experts say
entries.description: The government spends more of the aid budget at home than on direct help overseas, estimates indicate.

entries.title: Cost of living: Bridgend woman says kids worried they won't eat
entries.description: One mother says a charity is supporting her as the rising costs of heating and food hit home.

entries.title: The Highland haven insulated from rising energy prices
entries.description: A hydroelectric scheme provides power for the 120 people living in the remote community of Knoydart.

entries.title: Rail services disrupted by latest ScotRail 24-hour strike
entries.description: More than 2,000 RMT workers are staging another 24-hour stoppage after rejecting the latest pay offer.

entries.title: 'You think twice about driving': Fuel prices rise again
entries.description: The rise in diesel and petrol prices is having a particularly tough impact in rural areas.

entries.title: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola says Manchester United are finally coming back to form
entries.description: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola says Manchester United are on their way back to being competitive at the top of the table.

entries.title: Rugby League World Cup: New Zealand 48-10 Ireland highlights
entries.description: Jordan Rapana, Peta Hiku and Jahrome Hughes score two tries each as New Zealand produce dominant victory over Ireland at Headingley to leave the Wolfhounds on the brink of a World Cup exit.

entries.title: Gloucester 38-22 Exeter Chiefs: home side claim fourth consecutive Premiership win
entries.description: Gloucester win their fourth Premiership match in a row as they beat Exeter 38-22 in front of a sold-out Kingsholm.

entries.title: Rugby League World Cup: Crushing New Zealand win leaves Ireland facing exit
entries.description: New Zealand cruise to a 48-10 victory to leave a forlorn Ireland facing a group-stage exit from the World Cup.

entries.title: Olivia Pratt-Korbel: Further arrest in murder probe
entries.description: A man is arrested on suspicion of assisting an offender over the murder of the nine-year-old.

entries.title: Ebbw Vale: CCTV shows rogue driver wrecking police car
entries.description: Dino Price admitted dangerous driving, affray and driving without a licence or insurance.

entries.title: Mexican Grand Prix: Carlos Sainz fastest in first practice
entries.description: Carlos Sainz leads Charles Leclerc in a Ferrari one-two in first practice at the Mexican Grand Prix as 0.2 seconds separated the top six drivers.

entries.title: Attacked owl rescued by fishing crew 100 miles out to sea
entries.description: The long-eared owl was rescued after being attacked by gulls off the north coast of Scotland.

entries.title: Iran protests: Fresh clashes in Zahedan
entries.description: Security forces reportedly fire on protesters in Zahedan, as anti-government unrest continues.

entries.title: Suella Braverman in denial over forced resignation, sources say
entries.description: The home secretary tried to claim her data breach was "a minor thing", according to sources.

entries.title: Notorious singer Jerry Lee Lewis dies aged 87
entries.description: Jerry Lee Lewis, notorious singer behind Great Balls of Fire, dies aged 87 after life marred by scandal and violence.

entries.title: Wasps: Club suspended from Premiership for rest of the season
entries.description: The RFU confirms that Wasps have been suspended from the Premiership and Premiership Rugby Cup for the rest of the season.

entries.title: Obituary: Jerry Lee Lewis
entries.description: The notorious wild man of rock’n’roll - who married his 13-year-old cousin and shot his bass player - has died at 87.

entries.title: Mahek Bukhari murder trial: TikTok star 'told pack of lies to police'
entries.description: A court hears Mahek Bukhari denied any involvement in the death of her mother's former lover.

entries.title: Gisele Bundchen and Tom Brady announce divorce
entries.description: The pair confirm their separation and say they "arrived at this decision amicably".

entries.title: Manchester United: Antony says he will not change his ways
entries.description: Manchester United winger Antony says "I'm not going to stop doing what got me where I am" after his showboating in the Europa League.

entries.title: UK and France vow to tackle migrant boats
entries.description: Downing Street says the two leaders pledged to work on deterring "deadly journeys" in the Channel.

entries.title: NI Assembly election to be called but no date set
entries.description: NI Secretary Chris Heaton-Harris says he will give more more information next week.

entries.title: Piet Mondrian artwork displayed upside down for 75 years
entries.description: Despite the find Piet Mondrian's painting will continue to be shown as it is to avoid any damage.

entries.title: Red Bull: F1 team receive $7m fine & 10% aero research reduction
entries.description: Red Bull have been hit with a $7m (£6.07m) fine and a 10% reduction in permitted aerodynamic research for breaking Formula 1's budget cap.

entries.title: Elon Musk clears out Twitter bosses in $44bn deal
entries.description: The billionaire axes the social media platform's executives in his first move after buying the firm.

entries.title: Top US politician's husband assaulted after break-in
entries.description: An assailant broke into the couple's California home on Friday morning, a statement says.

entries.title: The woman set alight by her ex who 'got on with life'
entries.description: Jaqueline Kirk was not bitter and found solace in nature photography, those who knew her say.

entries.title: King takes on Royal Marines role once held by Harry
entries.description: The monarch becomes ceremonial head of the Royal Marines, a role previously held by his son.

entries.title: Watch: Patient tells PM to pay NHS staff more
entries.description: Rishi Sunak is told he is needs to "try harder" over plans to give pay rises to hospital staff.

entries.title: Rishi Sunak backtracks on £10 missed NHS appointment fines
entries.description: Rishi Sunak made the pledge during his first attempt to become Conservative leader earlier this summer.

entries.title: Neymar: Prosecutors drop fraud charges against Brazil & Paris St-Germain forward
entries.description: Prosecutors in Spain drop corruption and fraud charges against Brazil forward Neymar in a trial over his 2013 transfer from Santos to Barcelona.

entries.title: Edinburgh historic house owner ordered to repaint pink door
entries.description: She says it is "lunacy" as there are other brightly painted doors in her Edinburgh neighbourhood.

entries.title: Concern over flu and RSV as Covid stays level
entries.description: The flu season has started early and some young children under five are ending up in hospital.

entries.title: Russia ends civilian pull-out before Kherson battle
entries.description: An eight-day operation ends in Kherson city as Russian officials prepare for a Ukrainian attack.

entries.title: The crash dummy aimed at protecting women drivers
entries.description: Researchers in Sweden are close to completing an industry-first average female crash test dummy.

entries.title: Stormzy, Michaela Coel and Rashford named as influential black Brits
entries.description: The annual Powerlist recognises leading figures in the UK from African and Caribbean backgrounds.

entries.title: Freda Walker murder: Man jailed for torturing and killing woman, 86
entries.description: Vasile Culea tied up, gagged and severely beat a couple in their 80s at their home.

entries.title: Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg: Tottenham midfielder on caring for his dying father
entries.description: Tottenham midfielder Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg speaks to BBC's Football Focus about caring for his dying father while trying to make it at Bayern Munich.

entries.title: Baltimore Ravens beat the Tom Brady and the Tampa Bay Buccaneers
entries.description: Tom Brady loses a third straight NFL match for the first time in 20 years as his Tampa Bay Buccaneers side go down 27-22 at home to the Baltimore Ravens.

entries.title: People's memories projected on to Worcester buildings
entries.description: A "time travel trail" in Worcester sees special displays of photos and videos of residents reminiscing.

entries.title: COP27: Environment secretary defends Sunak for missing climate summit
entries.description: Therese Coffey says COP27 is "just a gathering", as the PM is criticised for skipping the event.

entries.title: North Somerset 'gimp' sightings: Teen describes 'freaky' encounter
entries.description: A man has been arrested on suspicion of causing a public nuisance and released on bail.

entries.title: 'Devious' killer who decapitated friend must serve 34 years
entries.description: Jemma Mitchell killed her friend Mee Kuen Chong to try to inherit her estate for home renovations.

entries.title: 'I forgot how to hold a bat' - rebuilding Ben Duckett
entries.description: Ben Duckett's long road back to Test cricket is much more than recovering from an incident in a Perth nightclub, says chief cricket writer Stephan Shemilt.

entries.title: British kayaker saved after days clinging to buoy in Channel
entries.description: A British man is rescued by a Dutch fishing boat after his kayak capsized miles off the French coast.

entries.title: Cambridge orchid in bloom smells like rotting cabbage
entries.description: An orchid that rarely flowers outside its native habitat in Asia it is creating a stink in Cambridge.

entries.title: What next for Twitter under Elon Musk?
entries.description: The BBC's technology editor looks at the path ahead for the tech company and the billionaire.

entries.title: Rihanna releases Lift Me Up from Black Panther: Wakanda Forever
entries.description: Lift Me Up is taken from the soundtrack of the forthcoming movie Black Panther: Wakanda Forever.

entries.title: Headless body trial: Woman to be sentenced on TV for murder
entries.description: Jemma Mitchell killed her friend Mee Kuen Chong to try to inherit her estate for home renovations.

entries.title: Pablo Mari: 'I was lucky' - Arsenal defender on Italy supermarket stabbing
entries.description: Arsenal defender Pablo Mari says he is "lucky" as he prepares to undergo back surgery after being stabbed in a supermarket near Milan.

entries.title: T20 World Cup: England-Australia match delayed by rain in Melbourne
entries.description: England's highly-anticipated Men's T20 World Cup match against Australia in Melbourne is delayed by rain.

entries.title: Ros Atkins On… Hu Jintao's China Congress exit
entries.description: A look at why China's former leader was led out of Communist Party Congress.

entries.title: Spanish fan detained in Iran while hiking to World Cup
entries.description: Santiago Sánchez was hiking from Madrid to Qatar, but is now believed to be in a Tehran jail.

entries.title: Katie Taylor: Long-awaited Croke Park homecoming 'definitely realistic'
entries.description: Katie Taylor believes a rematch with Amanda Serrano at a sold-out Croke Park can happen in 2023 as she prepares to fight Karen Carabajal on Saturday.

entries.title: National Living Wage: The truth about food courier pay
entries.description: A new BBC documentary looks into what it takes for food couriers to make money during an evening shift.

entries.title: How Rugby World Cup redemption drove England captain Sarah Hunter to 138 caps
entries.description: Five years ago, Sarah Hunter's heart was broken at the World Cup. She has taken her caps tally to a record-breaking 138 as she seeks redemption.

entries.title: Salcombe murder: AA man's 'bizarre' encounter with killer
entries.description: How an AA technician came face to face with Jemma Mitchell, who was dumping her victim's body.

entries.title: 'I was groomed and exploited at parties aged 14'
entries.description: A charity warns missing children are at risk of sexual exploitation, as school absence numbers rise.

entries.title: Leeds: Rare book laced with arsenic found in library
entries.description: The 19th Century gardening book owes its green colour to a dye containing arsenic, officials say.

entries.title: China Covid: Millions back in lockdown as Beijing doubles down on zero-Covid
entries.description: Dozens of cities across the country have been affected by varying degrees of restrictions.

entries.title: T20 World Cup: Ireland v Afghanistan match delayed by rain
entries.description: The start of the Men's T20 World Cup match between Ireland and Afghanistan is delayed because of rain at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.

entries.title: Ukraine war: Russia deploys dozens of drones in two days - Zelensky
entries.description: The Ukrainian president gives his latest address standing next to the wreckage of a destroyed drone.

entries.title: Elon Musk: How the world's richest person bought Twitter
entries.description: One of the most publicised and frenetic deals in Silicon Valley history has reportedly been completed.

entries.title: Elon Musk completes $44bn Twitter takeover
entries.description: A protracted deal ends as the billionaire and "free speech absolutist" buys the social media platform.

entries.title: How Brazil's election campaign turned ugly
entries.description: From disputed polls to "conspirituality", Brazil's presidential run-off has split society.

entries.title: Asian Network turns 20: 'A safe space for British Asians'
entries.description: From music to cultural discussions, Asian Network has provided a "community" feel for 20 years.

entries.title: 'I wouldn't bring a member of my family to this hospital,' says medic
entries.description: Gloucestershire Royal has some of England's worst ambulance waiting times, with a hard winter to come.
